intro: Rubroshorea palosapis, commonly known as the redshore maple, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its striking red bark and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in early spring, followed by red or orange berries that attract various bird species. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to full sun, making it a hardy plant in desert environments. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in its native habitat.
